Server Interface

The RemLib server interface provides functions to be used by player proxies to control and interact with the Remuco server. More...

Detailed Description

The RemLib server interface provides functions to be used by player proxies to control and interact with the Remuco server.

Typedef Documentation

typedef struct _RemServer RemServer

The RemServer struct is an opaque data structure to represent a Remuco server.

Function Documentation

void rem_server_down ( RemServer *  rem  ) 

Shuts down a RemServer.

Disconnects all clients and frees all of the memory used by a RemServer.

Parameters:
rem a RemServer
Remarks:
The function returns immediately but the shutdown process may take some more milli seconds. So please wait a bit before completely shutting down your process/app.
Todo:
may be a callback shutdown_finished() is a good idea
Remarks:
If rem_server_up() has been called with run_main_loop == TRUE, then rem_server_up() will return as a result of calling this function.

void rem_server_notify ( RemServer *  server  ) 

Notifies a RemServer about changes in a player.

The RemServer will later call RemPPCallbacks::synchronize to be up to date.

Parameters:
server a RemServer
Remarks:
Multiple calls to this functions in a very short time don't necessarily result in multiple calls to RemPPCallbacks::synchronize. RemLib processes the changes when the GMainLoop is some kind of idle.

RemServer* rem_server_up ( const RemPPDescriptor *  pp_desc,
const RemPPCallbacks *  pp_callbacks,
const RemPPPriv *  pp_priv,
GError **  err 
)

Starts a Remuco server.

Parameters:
[in] pp_desc Descriptor of the player proxy that starts the server.
[in] pp_callbacks Callback functions to use by the server to interact with the player proxy.
[in] pp_priv Player proxy private data. This will be used as first parameter for the functions in pp_callbacks.
[out] err Location to return error in case something fails starting the server fails.
Returns:
A RemServer which must be used as first parameter for rem_server_notify() and rem_server_down(). If an error occurs NULL will be returned and err will be set.
